pageContext.claim: “The new Rasmussen Poll, one of the most accurate in the 2016 Election, just out with a Trump 50% Approval Rating.That's higher than O's #'s!”
pageContext.analysis: The Rasmussen Presidential Tracking poll did show President Trump with a 50% approval rating on Friday, June 16, but it appears to be an outlier, given the other polls show Trump at 40 percent or lower. Moreover, on June 16, 2009, then-President Barack Obama had a 56% approval rating in the Rasmussen. While Rasmussen came close to predicting Hillary Clinton's margin of victroy in the popular vote -- which Trump has disputed -- the poll also predicted Clinton would win the Electoral College vote.
